sgcool_label_text:0104 was a showcase of Royston Tan’s films at the Alliance Française de Singapour.  \r\n\r\nHeld in march 2005
 12 of Tan’s 15 short films produced between 2001 and 2004 were screened on two days and the proceeds were used to help another local film-maker
 Bertrand Lee
 who had his leg amputated as a result of an accident in Mumbai. Before Singapore
 the screenings were also held in Chicago
 London and Tokyo\r\n\r\nThe brochure features the photograph of film maker in disguise along with the text in red.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
0104 was a showcase of Royston Tan’s films at the Alliance Française de Singapour.  

Held in march 2005, 12 of Tan’s 15 short films produced between 2001 and 2004 were screened on two days and the proceeds were used to help another local film-maker, Bertrand Lee, who had his leg amputated as a result of an accident in Mumbai. Before Singapore, the screenings were also held in Chicago, London and Tokyo

The brochure features the photograph of film maker in disguise along with the text in red.
